boone.util

Class ClassHelper

    • boone.util.ClassHelper

  • public final class ClassHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper for handling classes.

    Wed 2004-06-16
    Author:
    August Mayer, Helmut A. Mayer

    • Method Detail

      • instantiateByClassName

        public static java.lang.Object instantiateByClassName(java.lang.String className)
        Instantiates an Object by passing the name of the Class in a String. Only the no-arg constructor is used. If you want to use any other
        Parameters:
        className - the name of the Class to instantiate
        Returns:
        a new Object (null, if problems occurred)
        See Also:
        instantiateByClassName(String, String[], Object[]).

      • instantiateByClassName

        public static java.lang.Object instantiateByClassName(java.lang.String className,
                                                      java.lang.String[] constructorClassNames,
                                                      java.lang.Object[] constructorParameters)
        Instantiates an Object by passing the name of the Class in a String. The 'constructorClassNames' must contain the names of the Classes passed to the desired constructor of the Object. If the profile is null, the no-arg constructor is used. The parameters passed to the constructor must be in 'constructorParameters'.
        Parameters:
        className - the name of the Class to instantiate
        constructorClassNames - the names of the Classes of the parameters (may be null)
        constructorParameters - the actual parameters to the constructor (may be null)
        Returns:
        a new Object (null, if problems occurred)

      • getBasicName

        public static java.lang.String getBasicName(java.lang.Class c)
        Extract the basic class name from a Class object. This is the simple name of a class, without package or outer class names.

      • getQualifiedName

        public static java.lang.String getQualifiedName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the qualified name of a possibly unqualified class name.
        Parameters:
        name - an un/qualified name
        Returns:
        the qualified name

      • getClassPath

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getClassPath()
        Returns the class path. This class path also contains the potential class paths given in manifest files of JAR files. A Java application may be called via '-jar', which makes the standard class path only the given JAR file. However, in the manifest of the JAR file more class paths may be given, which are added to the class path here. Note that now we are not adding paths recursively (as in the manifest class path another JAR file could be given) (maybe, needed in the future).
        Returns:
        a list of paths

      • getNameFromClassPath

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromClassPath(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a path containing 'name' in the resources of the class path. Note, that the string 'name' refers to a resource name (e.g., "Test.class"). Also, if 'name' occurs multiple times only the first occurrence is returned. Paths containing an exclusion string defined in Boone are not searched.
        Parameters:
        name - a string
        Returns:
        a path containing 'name', null if not found

      • getNameFromFileSystem

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromFileSystem(java.lang.String path,
                                                     java.lang.String name)
        Returns a path containing 'name', where the search starts at 'path'. If the path is a directory, it is recursively searched for a sub-path containing 'name'. Only the sub-path is returned, if 'name' is found anywhere. If the path is a JAR file, then the JAR file is searched for an entry containing 'name'. The 'name' is the name of a resource,
        Parameters:
        path - path to a directory or a jar file
        name - a string
        Returns:
        sub-path to the file containing 'name', null if not found

      • getNameFromJar

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromJar(java.io.File file,
                                              java.lang.String name)
        Returns a jar file entry containing a resource with 'name'.
        Parameters:
        file - a jar file
        name - the resource name to be found in a jar entry
        Returns:
        the jar entry containing the resource 'name', null if not found

      • getNameFromDir

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromDir(java.io.File file,
                                              java.lang.String name)
        Returns the path to a file name containing 'name' starting recursively at directory 'file'.
        Parameters:
        file - a directory
        name - a string to be found
        Returns:
        a path to a file name containing 'name', null, if not found

      • containsClassName

        public static boolean containsClassName(java.lang.String path,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        char pathSeparatorChar)
        Checks if the given name is the name of a class in path. Before the name there must be either a file separator or an inner class separator to be deemed a class name. This is checked to avoid the following situation: searching for "Test.class", in the path there is a "MyTest.class", a simple check would return true, though there is no class named "Test.class".
        Parameters:
        path - a path
        name - a class name
        pathSeparatorChar - this char depends not only on the system, but also on the resource (e.g., JAR)
        Returns:
        true, if class name in path

      • createClassByName

        public static java.lang.Class createClassByName(java.lang.String cl)
                                         throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Returns a class by its name inclusively the primitive types and arrays of primitive types, e.g., int[].
        Parameters:
        cl - The name of the class / type.
        Returns:
        The class of the class / type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • getField

        public static java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.Object obj,
                                        java.lang.String name)
        Use Java Reflection to get the value of the object attribute for this Parameter. First tries to read the attribute value with getXY, then with isXY, then tries direct access, then gives up.
        Parameters:
        obj - Object whose attribute value to retrieve.
        name - Name of the attribute to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Attribute value, maybe wrapped in a wrapper object (Integer, Boolean, ...)
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if it didn't work.

      • getField

        public static java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.Object obj,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.Object defaultValue)
        Use Java Reflection to get the value of the object attribute for this Parameter. First tries to read the attribute value with getXY, then with isXY, then tries direct access, then gives up and returns the default value.

        Calls getField(Object, String).

        Parameters:
        obj - Object whose attribute value to retrieve.
        name - Name of the attribute to retrieve.
        defaultValue - Default value to return in case of an error.
        Returns:
        Attribute value, maybe wrapped in a wrapper object (Integer, Boolean, ...)

      • setField

        public static boolean setField(java.lang.Object obj,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.Object value)
        Set the value of this parameter. The value can either be a suitable Java wrapper object, or a String containing the value of a simple data type.
        Parameters:
        obj - Object whose attribute value to set.
        name - Name of the attribute to retrieve.
        value - Value to set the attribute to; can bei either an object, a wrapper for simple data types, or the value of a simple data type.
        Returns:
        True if it worked, false else.
